title: Error message when extracting frames
body:
**describe the bug** I am having trouble extracting frames from my videos. I successfully extracted frames from my first video but when trying to extract frames from the next video I received an error message. I tried to extract additional frames from the first video and now receive the error message with that video as well. Someone else working on this project, @neurologic , is able to extract frames from all videos using the same Deeplabcut version and Mac OS. I have tried extracting frames using both the command line interface and the GUI and run into the same error message. **Desktop (please complete the following information about your system):** - OS: MacOS Catalina - DeepLabCut Version 2.2b8 - DeepLabCut mode: multi-animal tracking **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior, i.e.: 1. deeplabcut.extract_frames(config_path,"automatic", "kmeans", True) 2. See error:
TRACEBACK

```python Do you want to extract (perhaps additional) frames for video: /Users/courtney/Documents/Wesleyan/Perks_Lab/mnt/GoogleDrive/Team Drives/PerksLab_DLC/DLC_projects/GroupBehavior0-LAB-2020-11-24/videos/Basler_acA1300-200um__23511574__20201122_121610140.avi ? yes/noyes Extracting frames based on kmeans ... Kmeans-quantization based extracting of frames from 0.0 seconds to 40.67 seconds. Extracting and downsampling... 610 frames from the video. 610it [00:22, 27.58it/s] Kmeans clustering ... (this might take a while) Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in File "/Users/courtney/Documents/Wesleyan/Perks_Lab/DeepLabCut/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/frame_extraction.py", line 276, in extract_frames color=cluster_color, File "/Users/courtney/Documents/Wesleyan/Perks_Lab/DeepLabCut/deeplabcut/utils/frameselectiontools.py", line 392, in KmeansbasedFrameselectioncv2 kmeans.fit(data) File "/Users/courtney/Documents/Wesleyan/Perks_Lab/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/cluster/_kmeans.py", line 1666, in fit order='C', accept_large_sparse=False) File "/Users/courtney/Documents/Wesleyan/Perks_Lab/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/base.py", line 420, in _validate_data X = check_array(X, **check_params) File "/Users/courtney/Documents/Wesleyan/Perks_Lab/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/utils/validation.py", line 72, in inner_f return f(**kwargs) File "/Users/courtney/Documents/Wesleyan/Perks_Lab/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/utils/validation.py", line 645, in check_array allow_nan=force_all_finite == 'allow-nan') File "/Users/courtney/Documents/Wesleyan/Perks_Lab/anaconda3/envs/DLC-CPU/lib/python3.7/site-packages/sklearn/utils/validation.py", line 99, in _assert_all_finite msg_dtype if msg_dtype is not None else X.dtype) ValueError: Input contains NaN, infinity or a value too large for dtype('float64'). ```

**Expected behavior** Expected frames to be extracted successfully **Screenshots**
